paragraphs.zh-tw: 你們有多少人愛節奏？好耶，好耶，好耶（歡呼）（打鼓）我是說，我愛各種節奏我喜歡玩爵士一點放克一點嘻哈一點流行音樂，一點節奏藍調一點拉丁非洲音樂
paragraphs.en: How many of you love rhythm? Oh yeah, oh yeah. Oh yeah. (Cheers) (Drumming) I mean, I love all kinds of rhythm. I like to play jazz, a little funk, and hip hop, a little pop, a little R&B, a little Latin, African.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 而這個律動來自紐奧良「遊行第二列」（爵士遊行的第二列）（歡呼聲）那，這些節奏都有一個共通點就是數學而我叫它數-數兒 （Arithmetic 算數）
paragraphs.en: And this groove right here, comes from the Crescent City, the old second line. (Cheers) Now, one thing all those rhythms have in common is math, and I call it a-rhythm-etic.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 請你跟我念一遍？數-數兒觀眾：數-數兒克麥隆：數-數兒觀眾：數-數兒

paragraphs.en: CC: Yeah. Now all those styles of rhythm are all counted in four and then subdivided by three.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 什麼？沒錯。三是個幻數三是律動的數字
paragraphs.en: What? Yeah. Three is a magic number. Three is a groovin' number.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 三是嘻哈那種的數字但以三分割是什麼意思？還有算四拍？好吧，就這樣想
paragraphs.en: Three is a hip-hop kind of number. But what does subdividing by three mean? And counting off by four? Well, look, think of it this way.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 把音樂的小節看成美金一元那一元是四個 25 分硬幣對吧？音樂一小節為 4/4 拍也是這樣
paragraphs.en: A measure of music as a dollar. Now a dollar has four quarters, right? And so does a 4/4 measure of music.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 它有四個四分音符那你要怎麼再分割？那讓我們想像一下這個：值三元的 25 分硬幣
paragraphs.en: It has four quarter notes. Now, how do you subdivide? Now let's envision this: three dollars' worth of quarters.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 你有三堆的四枚 25 分硬幣然後你開始數一二三四一二三四一二三四。一起來眾人：一二三四一二三四一二三四
paragraphs.en: You would have three groups of four, and you would count it, a-one-two-three-four, one-two-three-four, one-two-three-four. Together. All: A-one-two-three-four,one-two-three-four, one-two-three-four.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 克：好，你現在有感覺了嗎？現在讓我們把這三堆四枚硬幣變成四堆三枚硬幣聽好
paragraphs.en: CC: Okay, now you feel that? Now let's take those three groups of four and make them four groups of three. And listen to this.

paragraphs.en: A-one-two-three-four, one-two-three-four, one-two-three-four, with me. One-two-three-four, one-two-three, come on, y'all! All: One-two-three-four,one-two-three-four, one-two-three-four, ah.
